title: Frederick Douglass National Historic Site: Education
body: Teaching Himself, Teaching America Frederick Douglass knew the value of education. Today he can inspire reading, be an introduction to oratory, a muse for writing, a spur to civic engagement, and much more. We are here to help you bring Douglass to life in your classroom. Join us for our summer teacher fellowship or have us visit virtually. There are lots of ways to get involved.                 Teacher Workshops The possibilities for teaching with Douglass are limitless. Join us for a few hours or attend a week-long program to learn new content and techniques. Read More        Lesson Plans Use historic places and museum collections to teach your students about Frederick Douglass. Read More        Distance Learning Frederick Douglass has gone digital and can visit you in the classroom!
